name: The Inn at Pocono Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here Sept 30-Oct 3 to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary. (we actually honeymooned in the Pocono's at Brookdale 30 yrs ago but they closed a few years back) The atmosphere in the Inn was so tranquil. We had a great room, that we were able to watch the sunrise each morning. The weather was perfect 70/80's. Over all we had a wonderful stay and most likely would return We had buffet breakfast the first day, was good but bit pricey, and there was no option to just order breakfast. We did have dinner at the Exchange for our Anniversary dinner, it was excellent. The bartender (male) the first night was great. However the 2nd night, the bartender (female) seemed a bit frazzled and we felt that we were put on back burner. They had ground breaking for the new waterpark on the property. So the "big guys" were at the bar and we felt that bartender was ignoring us and waiting on them hand and foot. That was frustrating, as we were there first. We were not able to check out the gift shop as it was not open, very limited hours.
reviews.title: picture perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I actually stayed here twice. The first time was during New Years there were a few issues so they rewarded us a night free. I appreciated this since they were confident enough we could have a better stay. The second time we had a nice room with an impressive view. The view of the sunrise was priceless. We were able to see the sunrise because there was shouting in the hallway as a result of a domestic dispute around 4am. We called security and they responded very quickly to settle it down. I realize that a hotel cannot always control it's guests especially when those guests have been drinking all night at the wedding. Which leads me to conclude that I would definitely stay here again but would check to make sure a wedding was not scheduled. The food was very good. We ate at the restaurant inside the hotel (The Exchange), it was a bit pricey but good. We also paid for the breakfast buffet which was very good with a good selection. The hotel itself in the main building was very clean and the service at the front desk was helpful.
reviews.title: I would go back but only if a wedding was not going on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary weekend in the fall. We commented that this would be a great place to stay for any season. There are so many things to do, especially if you like spending time outdoors. We highly recommend the horseback riding down at the stables. We had never done this before and we both had a blast. The people that ran the stables were terrific and our ride was something that we will never forget. Although we did not get a chance to bring our clubs, everyone that we spoke to said both of the golf courses were immaculate. Our room was clean and comfortable and wow, the mattress was well...you will want to go out and buy one when you get home. If you get a chance, have dinner at least once at the Exchange, great food and even better service. Ask for a corner booth when making a reservation, a nice touch. Again, a terrific place to stay if you like the Pocono area and especially if you enjoy outdoor activities (plenty of options).
reviews.title: The Best of the Pocono Resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: We made an unplanned stop at the Inn on our way to New Jersey, and had a marvellous stay. The staff we encountered were all welcoming and friendly, from the front desk to room staff and all of our waiters, (including the fellow who sang to us at breakfast!). They recognized my wife and I are lesbians and immediately offered us a king sized bed without having to be asked, which is always nice. The room was very comfortable and we had a gorgeous view.
reviews.title: A wonderfully serendipitous stay at the Inn at Pocono Manor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had two meals during our stay. We both had burgers for supper in the pub and they were very good. The accompanying potato wedges were fantastic! Breakfast the next morning was ok; I had an omelette from the omelette station that was very well made, but the pancakes my wife had from the buffet had been sitting there for quite awhile and had suffered as a result, and her coffee wasn't very good. It would have been nice to see homemade breakfast pastries and breads rather than the supermarket style offered, but there was lots of fresh fruit to choose from and the bacon was delicious, so we certainly had more than enough to eat.
reviews.title: Missed Opportunity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently celebrated our 5 year anniversary at the Inn...our first trip alone since the birth of our son 1.5 years ago! The hotel was situated in a quiet and scenic area of the Poconos. We enjoyed spectacular views from our corner room in the newer tower --room 693 -- and each morning we scarfed down the excellent breakfast buffet, overlooking the mountains. There was also a nice hiking trail down to a waterfall to work off the buffet :)
reviews.title: Relaxing and beautiful long weekend in the Poconos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The great thing that was even though we felt secluded, we were so close to many area attractions. Just a few minutes away from the outlets and Mt Airy casino--we gambled there one night and had a not so good dinner. Dinner at the Inn's Exchange was MUCH better! The prime rib was delicious. We also did a tree-top obstacle course/zip line one day nearby which was a blast. The golf course had beautiful views and we had hoped to try clay shooting, but didn't have enough time! Next visit... Definitely a great place to stay and a great home-base for the Pocono area. And while this was a romanic getaway for us, plenty of couples had their kids in tow. This would be a great family vacation spot as well. We look forward to coming back!
reviews.title: Very relaxing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: This was the perfect place for our anniversary weekend. It had everything we needed and more! We especially loved the on site restaurant the Exchange, we ate there 2x and had excellent service by waitress Patricia. She was fantastic! We also took the shuttle to the casino which was extremely convienent ! An absolute must stay in the poconos!! If you are looking to relax and take in some fresh mountain air this is definitely the place to go! The only downside was no mini refrigerator in the room.
reviews.title: Outstanding Personal Service!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Traveling with our infant son, we had a few special request that were meet without hesitation and to our complete satisfaction! On our second stay, we had particularly exceptional service from front desk staff, Isaiah and engineering personal, Alonzo. A beautiful hisroric hotel for a great value, with many ammenties and a wonderful, hot, sit down breakfast buffet included with room. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: An Historic Experience & Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife, daughter, and I stayed at the property of Labor Day weekend. For starters, I have to say that we just really enjoyed the historic value of the Hotel and the property. We did not spend much time on the property itself; however, when we did, we enjoyed it. It's old world charm is great. We enjoyed our evening dining experiences there, and the two days we took advantage of the breakfast buffet. There are many points of interests in the area, and that is what we took advantage of during out visit. I will say that I thought the outdoor and indoor pool could have been a bit better. The outdoor pool needs a heater and the indoor pool because of its use just needs to be better maintained, but I can see how that is a challenge for them. Perhaps in the off season they will consider adding some of those features. I can see that they are doing work to the Hotel, which is always good to see. It did not bother us because I recognize it needs to be done. I would certainly consider returning in the future and perhaps taking advantage of more of the amenities and services they offer right there on the property.
reviews.title: Great Place for Family Gathering

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here in August 13. I must tell you its a lovely resort. I stayed just for two nights and it was a wonderful experience. Everything, starting from check-in, in-room services, restaurant, and check in - check out processes were very smooth.
reviews.title: Lovely resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: The room was fantastic, well-appointed with modern touches including an innovative wet-room shower/bath area. Stayed at Standard Room - Fantastically done up - Truly 5 Star Experience with Wow Service. The hotel's crisp modern architecture is matched with a high level of service. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Could Be A Lot Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed over Labor Day Weekend with my family. We had a room with two Queen beds. They were comfortable. One of the elevators was down due to it be refurbished; however, the guests and the staff were sharing the one other small elevators, and the staff did not seem to mind craming themselves in with guests. Is there no service elevator? The front desk staff seemed a bit indifferent when it came to welcoming guests and upon check-in, and little to no information was given about the Hotel, it's services, or the property. The doorman/bellmen also seem a bit tired and beat up. The room we stayed in was a decent size but it does need some work. It was unique, but tired. The bathroom was large, but the shower (half tub) is strange. The water pressure also leaves a lot to be desired. The pictures of the Hotel in the room from the days in which it was perhaps in its hayday were the nicest features in the room. The TV worked fine, and the wall unit A/C worked well but a but noisy. The outdoor pool was too cold to swim in, and the pool furniture was limited and not kept tidy. It also had a lit id dead bugs in it. They may have froze to death. The indoor pool was warmer but it did not look or feel clean. It was cloudy and again, the pool furniture leaves a lot to be desired. A plentiful breakfast buffet is available each morning in a very large ballroom/dining room, but again, the servers seem to be a bit withdrawn and tired. Overall, this property seems as if it would require millions of dollars to make it a true luxury property and then hiring and training staff members to run it as so. Even as it is now, the staff could be a lot better, but I think they are beat up a bit with complaints and the overall condition of the Hotel. The one thing that we found enjoyable was dinner at the property, which we had twice. It was in a smaller and more intimate setting, and service was friendly and above average overall. In a nutshell, the place has great potential.
reviews.title: Great place to getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property was very huge and secluded. The rooms very pretty nice and there are plenty of activities in the Summer and Winter. The staff is extremely friendly and helping. Overall, it was a great experience and I would definitely go back.
reviews.title: Decent, but poor value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've split this by Cons and Pros
reviews.title: Small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: High in the Pocono Mountains sits this grand old place with a majestic view. We found the staff to be very accomodating and the Spruce Lodge which is pet friendly to be very charming. The room we stayed in was spottless, and had plenty of towels and pillows. The grounds are well maintained and has a feel of old world charm. There is so much right here at the resort to do, golf, skeet shooting, horseback riding and a spa and fitness center. The local area has much to offer such as a casino, water gap trolley, Pocono Cheese Cake Factory, Country Junction (world's largest general store), Country Kettle Candy Shop, and even Speedways indoor go carts. I would give this a five star rating and would return again.
reviews.title: Great Place To Spend Our Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were recently there for Labor Day weekend... It was a prefect weekend to go because it wasn't too hot and it wasn't too busy, I guess because the kids were heading back to school. With any hotel, there's always pros and there's always cons.
reviews.title: Great trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE PROS:
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel With A Beautiful View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Molly the bartender in the Lamplighter lounge was personable and makes a delicious French martini!
reviews.title: Outdated hotel and rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Raymond our breakfast buffet server was hilarious and anticipated our needs.
reviews.title: Just awful

aka: The Inn At Pocono Manor Hotel
description: Our beautiful mountaintop location offers an 18 hole championship golf courses, fitness center, indoor and outdoor pools, state-of-the-art Spa, Riding Stables and various dining options. Just minutes from area attractions; casino, waterpark, skiing, outlet shopping and more!
